TextView.android:text: Factorial (n!):\nThis formula calculates the product of an integer and all the integers below it. For example, the factorial of 5 (5!) is 5*4*3*2*1 = 120.
Permutation (nPr):\nThe number of ways to arrange 'r' items from 'n' items where order matters. The formula is nPr = n! / (n-r)!
Combination (nCr):\nThe number of ways to select 'r' items from 'n' items where order does not matter. The formula is nCr = n! / r!(n-r)!
Binomial Theorem:\nThe formula is (x + y)^n = Î£ (from k=0 to n) (n choose k) * x^(n-k) * y^k.
Product Rule:\nIf there are n ways to do one thing, and m ways to do another, then there are n*m ways to do both.
Sum Rule:\nIf there are n ways to do one thing and m ways to do another, and you cannot do both, then there are n+m ways to choose one.
Difference Rule:\nIf there are n ways to do something, and m of these ways are not allowed, then there are n-m ways to do it.
Multiplication Principle of Counting:\nThe number of ways to perform a series of tasks is equal to the product of the number of ways each task can be performed.
